issue.subject: Use shorter dates in generated names for orders + make it customizable
issue.description:
Use shorter dates in generated names for orders, the are currently in "MySQL style" : "2015-12-09 09:24:16".
The date is 19 chars long, and the exact time is not very an interesting value for users (if a user needs the time, it is visible in the list and in the recap view).

I propose using a custom date string in translations (JHtml::date + JText), which is dependent of the language of the user and is overridable.
We can use DATE_FORMAT_JS1 as default, it is 8 to 9 chars long. It will give:
fr-FR : "j/m/y" -> "9/12/15"
en-GB and en-US : "y-m-d" -> "15-12-09"
de-DE : "d.m.y" -> "09.12.15"

An auto generated request name would become : "Yves Blatti 9/12/15" instead of "Yves Blatti 2015-12-09 09:24" in french.
Any administrator can edit the date format, or remove the date from the name.

custom_fields.name: Functional impact
custom_fields.value: an administrator can override the the date format

custom_fields.name: Ergonomic impact
custom_fields.value: Dates could be shorter (by default), less impacts on lists etc...
